intro: Tetrathylacium longirachis, commonly known as the long-stemmed tetrathylacium, is a rare and unusual plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its elongated, slender stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant is native to specific regions of Southeast Asia, where it grows in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinct, aromatic scent. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
